This enables you to ask us to suspend the processing of your personal data in the following scenarios: (a) if you want us to establish the data's accuracy; (b) where our use of the data is unlawful but you do not want us to erase it; (c) where you need us to hold the data even if we no longer require it as you need it to establish, exercise or defend legal claims; or (d) you have objected to our use of your data but we need to verify whether we have overriding legitimate grounds to use it.
We may collect and process the following data about you: When we engage you to provide us with your goods or services, we may collect data as follows: your name, your email address, your phone number, your quotes, transaction details about payments made to you, your bank details and other details of services or goods we have purchased from you.
We may collect and process the following data about you: When you visit Our Site, we may collect data such as information about your geolocation, weblogs and other communication that is available from the browser.

We may collect and process the following data about you: When you visit Our Site, we may collect data such as information about your geolocation, weblogs and other communication that is available from the browser.

We may collect and process the following data about you: If you submit a job application to us, we will collect your contact details and any other information that you provide in the application.
We may collect and process the following data about you: When you contact us by any other means (e.g. email or telephone), we may keep a record of that contact and the information you provide us with at the time.
We may collect and process the following data about you: When you fill in a form on our website to request a demo, we will collect your contact details and the information you provide in the form.

We may disclose your personal data with third-parties as follows: With other service providers who we engage to assist us in providing our services (such as hosting partners which host our servers, with a customer success tool provider that helps us improve your experience when using our services, emails broadcaster that helps us in sending you monthly marketing and technical information, forum providers which enable our users to exchange ideas on how to improve our services, and financial services providers which process payments made to and from us) in order to comply with our contractual obligations as set out in our terms of service and other agreements in place.

We may collect and process the following data about you: When you engage us to provide you with our services, we may collect data about you as follows: your name, your email address, your password, your telephone number, including your mobile number, your company billing address and your company's banking details.

PRIVACY POLICY

Glasscubes Limited (" we ", " us ") are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy and personal data.

We may disclose your personal data with third-parties as follows: With other service providers who we engage to assist us in providing our services (such as hosting partners which host our servers, with a customer success tool provider that helps us improve your experience when using our services, emails broadcaster that helps us in sending you monthly marketing and technical information, forum providers which enable our users to exchange ideas on how to improve our services, and financial services providers which process payments made to and from us) in order to comply with our contractual obligations as set out in our terms of service and other agreements in place.
We may also collect information about your assets, transaction details about payments made to and from you and other details of services you have purchased from us.
They enable us: to store information about your preferences, and so allow us to customise Our Site according to your individual interests;
